This is utilizing a default template from WPilib, GitHub - wpilibsuite/vendor-template , this was the link that was used.

We aren’t sure how to debug this issue, and we’re hoping for some help to resolve it. @calcmogul

Steps we did:

Cloned the repository above

Edited Vendor json file

Tried to do spotless apply and publish

Noticed the error on both commands

Thank you in advance.

posts.name: Tyler Veness
posts.cooked: You’re using the Windows command prompt, so use gradlew.bat instead of gradlew . Perhaps that file is missing?

image 750×435 21.7 KB

image 750×435 21.7 KB

image 750×435 21.7 KB

We are trying to build the file through menu options but we’re still getting the same error. Additionally, we had tried to run the command by hand which didn’t work as well.

Here’s what we did:

Opened Command Prompt and Powershell

Changed directory to my project folder

Executed call gradlew.bat :spotlessApply

This was the output: “Error: Could not find or load main class org.gradle.wrapper.GradleWrapperMain Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.gradle.wrapper.GradleWrapperMain”

posts.name: Thad House
posts.cooked: That template is not a robot project. The build commands in vscode won’t work. Command line is required. Are you trying to make a vendor dep? If not, that’s not the way to create a project.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: They are trying to migrate our functional 2024 vendordep to 2025 . The command posted , typically we’ve run spotlessApply , then publish to “build” , then copy to the repos folder which is defined in our json vendordep file. Happy to share more details if necessary .

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
Assuming that this is your library: GitHub - BobcatRobotics/BobcatLib: BobcatLib!

I noticed that your build.gradle for has some version conflicts. For example you have 2025 gradlerio and a 2024 OpenCV.

It would be better to either remove the dependency on gradlerio, and update the build.gradle to match the latest vendor-template to have the right 2025 dependencies for native-utils or to remove all the native-utils stuff and just use gradlerio. Since it looks like your library is pure java, the latter should be easier.

That wouldn’t cause the issue you reported above, but based on the commit history, it looks like you’ve worked past that.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: We should close this as it was solved. We are experiencing no issues anymore.
